definition[0]: to not be caught or punished when you have done something wrong
example[0]: Watch Frank – he’ll cheat if he thinks he can get away with it.
example[1]: No one insults my family and gets away with it!
definition[1]: to not be punished for doing something wrong
example[2]: Some of those children get away with murder!
definition[2]: to receive only a small punishment for something
example[3]: The charge was reduced to manslaughter, and she got away with three years in prison.
definition[3]: to do something without experiencing any problems or difficulties, even though it is not the best thing to do
example[4]: At school he had always got away with doing the bare minimum amount of work.
example[5]: The colour’s not quite right, but I think you’ll get away with it.
